column.name: DWH_SOURCE_IND
column.comment: Indicator from which system the data record comes (2: Debit, 3: Credit).

column.name: MARKET_CODE
column.comment: Market to which the customer is assigned. Examples are MMC (credit customers who have a contract with VfD2), PUC (credit customers who have a contract with a partner company), MMO (prepaid customers who are directly assigned to VfD2), PUA (prepdaid customers who have a partner company) are), XMK ​​(Cross Market).

column.name: SV_SEQ
column.comment: Service-Voucher serial number

column.name: SYS_CREATION_DATE
column.comment: Date of creation of the data record in the operative system

column.name: SYS_UPDATE_DATE
column.comment: Date of modification of the data record in the operative system

column.name: OPERATOR_ID
column.comment: Unique ID of the last user

column.name: APPLICATION_ID
column.comment: Unique ID of the application that last processed the sentence

column.name: BAN
column.comment: Indication of the customer's billing account number. The customer is the (natural or legal) person to whom services are made available on the basis of a contract concluded with D2-Vodafone. For himself or others to him

column.name: SUBSCRIBER_NO
column.comment: Participant number

column.name: VOUCHER_ID
column.comment:
The Voucher id used to replenish prepaid subscriber. - Real Vouchers: Voucher_ID known in VOMS.
Logical Vouchers (single): Copy of field SV_SEQ
Logical Vouchers (renewal): The VOUCHER_ID of the "" original "" SV, meaning the first SV of an Abo or the first

column.name: SV_TYPE
column.comment: Service Voucher Type

column.name: SERVICE_TYPE
column.comment: Typing of the service according to price plan, SOC, promotional SOC etc. Valid values ​​are: P - Price Plan, M - Reduced Price Plan, R - Regular SOC, S - Reduced SOC, O - Optional SOC, B - Buy-One-Get -One SOC, T - Toll RS, L - Toll SOC for RC.

column.name: REDEMPTION_DATE
column.comment: The date when the voucher was redeemed.

column.name: SUB_SV_COUNTER
column.comment: Counter of the sub service voucher. - Counter of the sub SV. For SV which do not have sub vouchers (not 3for2) it is 1. If the SV is of the type 3for2 (or in general contains sub SVs), then the real SV becomes the counter 1, and  the following logical SVs

column.name: REDEEMED_BY
column.comment: ID of the operator who redeemed the voucher. - Null if not redeemed over CSM. NULL will be the usual value.

column.name: PRICE
column.comment: The fixed price that is requested for a billable item.

column.name: INITIAL_EXPIRATION_DATE
column.comment: This field will be filled initially by the value calculated during the service voucher redemption. - The date when the voucher should expire. It will be calculated during the redemption.

column.name: REAL_EXPIRATION_DATE
column.comment: Real expiration date  - This field will be filled initially populated with the future date (4700). Later the expiration engine will update in the case when "X or less" transaction returns counter value other than expected. This could then trigger a re-rat

column.name: VOUCHER_STATUS
column.comment:
voucher status during life cycle - Q - Requested Purchase - charge requested
I - Initiated purchased/redeemed - IN counter update initiated
A - Active IN counter update confirmed
T - To be expired Expiration requested by sending counter update to IN
E

column.name: VOUCHER_STATUS_DATE
column.comment: Date of Status

column.name: SMS_STATUS
column.comment:
Describes which SMS has been sent - Default=NULL
Z - Zero
E - Expired
W - Warning expiration

column.name: WARNING_SMS_DATE
column.comment: Date when to send a warning SMS.

column.name: BOOKING_TYPE
column.comment:
Booking type - R - Redeem (real SV)
P - Purchase (logical SV)

column.name: BOOKING_CHANNEL
column.comment:
Channel of booking - C - CSM
I - IVR
S - SMS
W - Web/WAP

column.name: EFFECTIVE_DATE
column.comment: Effective date of change - Date when the voucher is going to be effective (either immediately on redemption / purchase or future dated in case of running subscription).

column.name: CAMPAIGN_ID
column.comment: Campaign Id

column.name: FILLER
column.comment: N/A
